result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Michael Moon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and DNA surcharge.  To be paid as a condition of probation on case 14CF612.  If not paid, a civil judgment to issue.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick Michael Moon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Domestic Abuse Repeater and Habitual Criminalty Repeater.  
--- ** This now makes this charge a misdemeanor.

AS TO CHARGE (w/o domestic abuse and habitual criminality repeater), defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

Courts finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CF130), in the House of Correction with credit for 21 days time served.  

 * Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and DNA surcharge as determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   as a condition of probation (on case 2014CF612), of if NOT paid, a CIVIL JUDGMENT to issue.  

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed. Copy given to defendant. -- mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 FILE NOT IN COURT.  Upon the motion of State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Cases 2014CF130 and 2014CF000612.  Court ordered case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-10-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

14RM003533  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
1/28/14 vf

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription, no firearms and no contact with Roxanne G., or the address of 1619 Rawson Avenue (L), South Milwaukee, WI.   mld

Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4-16-2014 at 8:30 am.  

Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.    mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ROXANNE G.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with BREATHALYZER TESTS AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Patrick Michael Moon in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
